messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Hi, my name is Maria. I'm calling because my teacher, Mr. Haynes, he's throwing things and knocked over the table and screaming at us like he's going crazy.
And where is this occurring?
In Selby Lane School in Redwood City.
In which school?
Selby Lane.
Selby Lane School?
Yeah.
And you said the teacher is doing this?
Yeah, the teacher is going crazy. He's throwing tables.
Where are you calling from right now? Where are you?
I'm calling from my friend's phone.
And when did this happen?
It's happening right now.
But you're at your friend's house?
No, I'm in school. I'm in the bathroom.
You're in the bathroom at school?
Yeah.
Okay, what room at the school?
Room 505.
Room 505?
Yeah.
And what teacher is it?
It's Mr. Haynes, H-A-Y-N-E-S.
Do you know why he's acting like this?
No, he just started calling us names and throwing things.
Okay, hold on. Let me dispatch the officers. Don't hang up and stay where you are, okay?
Okay.
Okay. What's your name?
Maria.
And you're calling from your friend's phone?
Yeah, my phone ran out of battery.
That's okay. Where's your friend? Is she there with you?
No, she's in the classroom.
Okay, you're in which bathroom? Is there more than one girl's bathroom there?
Yeah, it's upstairs in the biggest building. There's one bathroom at the end of the hall.
Okay, what I want you to do is stay on the phone with me until we get there. We're on our way now, okay?
Okay, thank you.
Okay, you said room 505, right?
Yes.
Do you want to try and leave the bathroom?
No, I want to stay here.
Okay, then stay where you feel safe. How many kids are in the classroom?
About 20-something students.
Do you know if he has any weapons?
I don't know, but I recorded him throwing a table.
Okay, hold on just a minute.
Hello?
I'm still here. Are you okay?
Yeah, but I'm scared.
I know you're scared. Everything's going to be fine. We're there to help you.
Okay.
Do you have a dog?
Wait, what?
Do you have a dog? Think happy thoughts.
There are people here; I'm afraid they'll tell him what I'm doing.
Tell them to be quiet. You're doing the right thing.
Okay.
Okay, stay on the phone with me. Do you feel safe walking out towards the front of the school?
No, I want to stay here.
Okay, then stay there. Are the other people gone?
Just my friend is here.
Okay, stay where you're at and keep talking to me.
Okay, but my friend needs her phone back. She has to go home soon.
I need you to stay on the phone with me for a few more minutes, okay? Tell your friend she needs to wait a little bit.
Okay. Some people are saying the police are here.
Yes, the police are there now. If you want to stay in the bathroom, go ahead. I'll have an officer come to you, okay?
Okay, I'll be here.
Hold on.
